Table of Contents

NAME

SYNOPSIS

DESCRIPTION

The function searches an array of objects, the initial member of which is pointed to by for a member that matches the object pointed to by The size of each member of the array is specified by The contents of the array should be in ascending sorted order according to the comparison function referenced by The routine is expected to have two two arguments which point to the object and to an array member, in that order, and should return an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero if the object is found, respectively, to be less than, to match, or be greater than the array member.

RETURN VALUES

The function returns a pointer to a matching member of the array, or a null pointer if no match is found. If two members compare as equal, which member is matched is unspecified.

SEE ALSO

STANDARDS

The function conforms to
